p: The prevention and control of mosquito-borne diseases is primarily reliant on vector control measures, such as the use of insecticides, mosquito nets and environmental management to limit human-vector contact [ 5]. Over the last decade, approaches such as the release of Wolbachia-infected mosquitoes [ 99, 100] and genetically modified mosquitoes [ 101, 102] into native mosquito populations have been undertaken. These approaches aim to either reduce viral capacity in vector populations or reduce reproductive success.
